# Sample iptables rules for testing the optimizer
# Generated by iptables-save v1.8.7 on Sat Jul 26 2025

*filter
:INPUT ACCEPT [0:0]
:FORWARD ACCEPT [0:0]
:OUTPUT ACCEPT [0:0]

# Basic security rules
-A INPUT -i lo -j ACCEPT
-A INPUT -m conntrack --ctstate RELATED,ESTABLISHED -j ACCEPT

# SSH access
-A INPUT -p tcp --dport 22 -j ACCEPT
-A INPUT -p tcp --dport 22 -s 192.168.1.0/24 -j ACCEPT

# HTTP/HTTPS
-A INPUT -p tcp --dport 80 -j ACCEPT
-A INPUT -p tcp --dport 443 -j ACCEPT

# DNS
-A INPUT -p udp --dport 53 -j ACCEPT
-A INPUT -p tcp --dport 53 -j ACCEPT

# Redundant rules (for testing)
-A INPUT -p tcp --dport 80 -j ACCEPT
-A INPUT -p tcp --dport 22 -j ACCEPT

# Conflicting rules (for testing)
-A INPUT -p tcp --dport 8080 -j ACCEPT
-A INPUT -p tcp --dport 8080 -s 10.0.0.0/8 -j DROP

# Inefficient ordering (broad rule before specific)
-A INPUT -j DROP
-A INPUT -p tcp --dport 25 -j ACCEPT

# Custom chain example
:CUSTOM_CHAIN - [0:0]
-A INPUT -j CUSTOM_CHAIN
-A CUSTOM_CHAIN -p tcp --dport 3306 -s 192.168.1.100 -j ACCEPT
-A CUSTOM_CHAIN -j RETURN

COMMIT

*nat
:PREROUTING ACCEPT [0:0]
:INPUT ACCEPT [0:0]
:OUTPUT ACCEPT [0:0]
:POSTROUTING ACCEPT [0:0]

# NAT rules
-A POSTROUTING -o eth0 -j MASQUERADE
-A PREROUTING -p tcp --dport 8080 -j REDIRECT --to-port 80

COMMIT

*mangle
:PREROUTING ACCEPT [0:0]
:INPUT ACCEPT [0:0]
:FORWARD ACCEPT [0:0]
:OUTPUT ACCEPT [0:0]
:POSTROUTING ACCEPT [0:0]
COMMIT
